input_text:
Job Title: Chemist

Location: Palm Springs, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Qualifications•Bachelor’s Degree in Chemistry and/or equivalence in science related field•Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in color cosmetics formulation or,•Combination of experience and relevant education•Employee management skills•Business and functional expertise•Strategic thinking•High performer under pressure•Proven problem solving and analytical skills•Demonstrate creativity, flexibility, and use of innovative approaches•Ability to interact with internal and external groups•Strong computer skills (MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio)•Ability to prioritize•Able to work in a fast-paced environment•Project management skills•Leadership skills•Positive & Communicative•Questioning & Challenging•Accountable & Transparent•Team Oriented•“Can do” problem solving attitude•Process Focused•Results oriented•Quality focused•Lack of blame attitudeResponsibilities•To coordinate and manage “day-to-day” formulation lab activities in support of the business needs•Develop and replicate personal care formulation by due dates•Manage and coordinate day to day lab regulatory requirements for product development•Research & formulation development of skincare, body care, Hair care and OTC products•Ensure effective communication coordination and communication with Pilot and Quality•Comply with GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices)•Ensure that customers’ expectations are met/exceeded•Manage “day-to-day” projects, based on product briefs and development requests•Assess project feasibility and assign work to lab technicians/chemist based on the degree of complexity and skills required•Keep time schedule for submissions to marketing, formula evaluation, pilot schedule, stability, safety testing, etc•Ensure all samples required per project are provided to customer•Negotiate timing and project related aspects with other teams including formulations and project management•Keep a clean record of formulation in lab notebook•Complete COAs (Certificate of Analysis) for new formulas•Provide Formulas on time•Assist Pilot with new formulations•Work closely with Quality Control•Assist in maintaining the introduction of new raw material to a minimum•Responsible for successful R&D contributions•Communicate to direct supervisor any issue related to project feasibility•Interface with contractors and suppliers•Ensure effective coordination and communication with Marketing and Sales Department•Interact with Process Engineers, Production, Purchasing and Quality Control Department•Assist Marketing/Sales with technical expertise and make joint visits as needed to meet existing or new customers•Maintain laboratory safety standards•Perform routine analytical and physical tests•Perform other tasks as assigned by supervisor KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPI)•Schedule adherence•PDR moved on time•Value saved: Bulk and raw material cost saving

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Chemist
soft_skills: Proven problem solving and analytical skills
Interaction with internal and external groups
job_responsibilities: Coordinate and manage ‘day-to-day’ formulation lab activities
Develop and replicate personal care formulation by due dates
Manage and coordinate day to day lab regulatory requirements for product development
Research & formulation development of skincare, body care, Hair care and OTC products
Ensure effective communication coordination and communication with Pilot and Quality
Comply with GMP (Good Manufacturing Practices)
Ensure that customers’ expectations are met/exceeded
Manage ‘day-to-day’ projects, based on product briefs and development requests
Assess project feasibility and assign work to lab technicians/chemist based on the degree of complexity and skills required
Keep time schedule for submissions to marketing, formula evaluation, pilot schedule, stability, safety testing, etc
Ensure all samples required per project are provided to customer
Negotiate timing and project related aspects with other teams including formulations and project management
Keep a clean record of formulation in lab notebook
Complete COAs (Certificate of Analysis) for new formulas
Provide Formulas on time
Assist Pilot with new formulations
Work closely with Quality Control
Assist in maintaining the introduction of new raw material to a minimum
Responsible for successful R&D contributions
Communicate to direct supervisor any issue related to project feasibility
Interface with contractors and suppliers
Ensure effective coordination and communication with Marketing and Sales Department
Interact with Process Engineers, Production, Purchasing and Quality Control Department
Assist Marketing/Sales with technical expertise and make joint visits as needed to meet existing or new customers
Maintain laboratory safety standards
Perform routine analytical and physical tests
Perform other tasks as assigned by supervisor
benefits: KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS (KPI)•Schedule adherence•PDR moved on time•Value saved: Bulk and raw material cost saving
